msgSnippet: ... No you don t. You either need to test the public methods that call the private static function or you need to delete the function if nothing in the public

Subject: Re: [junit] How to test a static private function
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=12653864; y=RqSi3S8MF0frlm0sYA2PXxbxxyap_Hx7dMKMDvc_80JrEQmK

Prasad wrote:
> hi everybody,
>
> Iam new to JUnit.I have to test a static private function. 
>   


No you don't. You either need to test the public methods that call the 
private static function or you need to delete the function if nothing in 
the public (or protected) interfaces call it.


--
Elliotte Rusty Harold
subject: Re: [junit] How to test a static private function
